intro: Serjania pubescens f. glabrescens, commonly known as the smooth serjania, is a variant of the serjania plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its smooth, glabrous bark and leaves. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its flowers are usually yellow or orange, and it produces small, woody fruits. It is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, thriving in well-drained soils.
